intro: Ruellia montana, commonly known as the mountain ruellia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple, blooming throughout the growing season. Ruellia montana thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its adaptability and aesthetic appeal contribute to its widespread cultivation in warm climates.
